sn4.14:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Kosalans near the brahmin village of Ekasālā.
sn4.14:4.2: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dharma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.
sn4.14:5.2: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dharma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.
sn4.14:5.3: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”
sn4.14:5.4: The Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha
sn4.14:6.4: don’t get caught up in favoring and opposing.”
sn4.14:7.2: out of compassion for their welfare.
sn4.14:8.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
